definition: to add oil/to top up with gas/to refuel/to accelerate/to step on the gas/(fig.) to make an extra effort/to cheer sb on
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning
gas station
to add oil to the fire (idiom); fig. to aggravate a situation/to enrage people and make matters worse
to add interest (to a story)/to sex up
gas station attendant
fuel nozzle

sentences.english: Look, Dashan. There's a service station straight ahead.
sentences.chinese: 大山，你看，前邊有一家加油站。

sentences.english: Her husband has only been able to find part-time work at a gasoline station.
sentences.chinese: 她的丈夫只能夠找到一個加油站兼職工作。
不執行加油任務的航程爲11，500英里。

sentences.english: I'm almost out of gas. Do you know where the nearest gas station is?
sentences.chinese: 車快沒油了。你知道最近的加油站在哪裏嗎？

sentences.english: Today, I gave my boyfriend a spontaneous blowjob while we were watching TV.
sentences.chinese: 今天我在加油站給一個老女人加油。

sentences.english: Today, I gave my boyfriend a spontaneous blowjob while we were watching TV.
sentences.chinese: 今天我在加油站給一個老女人加油。

sentences.english: You drive to a gasoline station once a week, on average, and you fill up.
sentences.chinese: 你平均一週去一次加油站加滿油。

sentences.english: He abused his car by not changing the oil, and now it needs major repairs.
sentences.chinese: 他用車用得太狠，老不加油，現在車須要大修了。

sentences.english: China refuels , Beijing Olympic Games refuel .
sentences.chinese: 中國加油，北京奧運加油。

sentences.english: China refuels , Beijing Olympic Games refuel .
sentences.chinese: 中國加油，北京奧運加油。

sentences.english: You'd better gas up the car.
Ensure non-fuel business merchandising in convenient store of service station.
sentences.chinese: 確保加油站便利店非油品產品的供應。

sentences.english: I pulled the throttles to idle just south of Sicily , but we still overran the refueling tanker awaiting us over Gibraltar.
sentences.chinese: 即便如此我們還是超過了直布羅陀的加油機。

sentences.english: Aviation Agency said the helicopter landed for refueling in the crash.
sentences.chinese: 航空署說，直升機是在準備降落加油時墜毀的。

sentences.english: Self-Serve Debit And Credit Card Only.
While pumping the gas, we clapped our hands and jumped around to stay warm.
sentences.chinese: 加油時，我們一邊搓手一邊蹦來跳去地取暖。

to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
(idiom) a good person, used to praise sb's moral integrity or courage
surname Zhu
to wish/to express good wishes/to pray/(old) wizard
to continue the struggle (idiom); to persist/unremitting efforts
to like (an online post on Weibo, Facebook etc)
to wish
to thank/thanks/thank you
shout/rallying cry/cheering/to shout
to encourage
to top up/to fill to the brim
great effort/to strive/to try hard
(modal particle indicating suggestion or surmise)/...right?/...OK?/...I presume.
(onom.) smack!
bar (loanword) (serving drinks, or providing Internet access etc)/to puff (on a pipe etc)/(onom.) bang/abbr. for 貼吧|贴吧[tie1 ba1]
(express) thanks/gratitude/grateful/thankful/thanks
to look forward to/to await/expectation
